stories.text:
I've always interpreted technical debt as: 'Doing something in a half-assed way and then paying for it later'.

What strategies and methods are you using to combat this?
stories.title: Ask HN: How do you deal with technical debt?
NFT Prizes for Virtual Cycling Race Winners
Will eFuels save combustion engine? (interview about Prometheus Fuels)

stories.text:
A lot of recent evidence points to Facebook and other social media platforms as being addictive, divisive, misinformation-ridden, and destructive to society and democracy. I personally tend to avoid them as I don't feel they add much to my life.

I'm considering advertising a side project on Facebook. But - ad money is what fuels this particular beast, and pays the generous salaries of those keeping it running. So maybe the ethical thing is to not supply any additional dollars, however small, and bid up the value of the captive attention of their user base?

Not that my ad purchases would matter statistically, and I should be wary of getting on a high horse here. And there are many other ways to make a positive difference to the social media dilemma - better regulation, disciplined use as a user, etc.

Anyway, curious what others here think about the ethics of purchasing social media ads.
stories.title: Ask HN: Is it ethical to purchase Facebook ads?
Why Developing Countries Can Make the Top Covid Vaccines
